Reviews.Title: Some people just LIVE to complain
Reviews.Author: oldpink "Dark Side of the Moon"
Reviews.Content: First, I did not buy mine from Amazon, instead electing to get it instantly at Wal-Mart.I am also far from a camera expert.With that said, I was quite pleased with this camera, which was a huge upgrade over my old Kodak DC340.First, I REALLY like the generous 12x zoom with this camera, which enabled me to get excellent quality photos with good detail of two particular wary birds, a Bob White quail, and an Eastern Bluebird.I also found the imagine stabilization feature useful for my less than completely still hands, and I need to reiterate that image stabilization has NOTHING to do with capturing a fast moving object, as Spacejockey seemed to believe.Also, far from being annoyed by the flash having a button to pop it up, I really like being able to manually disable flash by leaving the flash physically latched down instead of having to mess around with menu controls to do it.I fail to see how this is a negative, Spacejockey.Likewise, I quite liked the intelligent face detection feature, which seemed to be particularly useful for the excellent automatic red eye removal feature.Again, Spacejockey, why the grumbling about this feature?Another point of contention is the gripe about the "double clicking" when taking photos.Well, you can override that by pressing the shutter button completely without pause, but the first click is to allow you ensure your lens is fully focused on your target before committing to taking the shot.You can press halfway, see if the focus indicator is on your target, then squeeze the rest of the way to take the shot.Again, why the complaint about that?Regarding the yellowish cast to photos taken indoors without flash, that is easily overcome by using the basic manual controls, which allow you to set the exposure appropriate to the lighting, which includes the "Tungsten" setting that is indicated for use indoors under incandescent lighting.Problem solved, and I have to wonder why Spacejockey couldn't trouble himself to look into that before grumbling about that.One point where I must agree with Spacejockey is the idiotic choice of micro USB connector instead of the far more common and useful mini USB connector used on most other portable electronic devices.It's not as if this large camera had a space constraint to require that.Was Fuji simply out to make its customers carry an extra cable instead of the mini-USB they already have for their other devices?One related complaint of my own, since I find myself instead electing to pop out the SD card to insert into an external card reader, is that it was a poor choice indeed to put the SD card slot inside the battery compartment, thus requiring the camera be powered off and having a fragile battery door undergo a finite open/close cycle that will accelerate it breaking and reducing the camera to an expense block of plastic.Also, Spacejockey, macro mode should NEVER use zoom.You want more detail for a close object, I suggest you GET CLOSER.Sheesh!Again, I have to disagree about the menu system, which I found easy to figure out, without really having to resort to the manual.I also really like how large the LCD display is.I tend to agree with the complaint about the lack of a printed manual, but this is a sad trend among electronic manufacturers these days.Witness the utter lack of printed documentation AT ALL when you open up that stylish box your iPod comes in.Regarding the inability to read the documenation found on the CD, I would suggest you contact Fuji to let them know that your disk was scratched and unreadable on a number of different computersm, and request they send you a free undamaged CD.Regarding the panorama mode, I would not even consider using that in the field, unless I had a tripod and carefully positioned each shot to make the overlap as seamless as possible.Failing that, I would do it up right on my computer with an image editor, so I have to wonder again at what seems a gratuitous gripe about a feature that Spacejockey probably never intended to use anyway.Speaking of gripes, why the grumbling about lack of filters or lens accessories on a camera that is NOT an SLR?This is a mid to high end point-and-shoot camera, and a motorized lens that moves in and out can get easily damaged by a filter or other such appliance attached to it.Spacejockey, have you really thought that complaint through?Sorry to sound as if I have some kind of axe to grind with Spacejockey, but I am a firm believer that a critical review really should focus upon being both fair and factual, and too many of the gripes leveled at this low to mid range camera seemed really lacking in both departments.Anyone who has used the pocket sized point-and-shoot cameras, such as my old Kodak, will immediately see the improvement of this camera over those, but anyone wanting all the features demanded by Spacejockey would be better served with one of the better digital SLR cameras instead.However, those SLR cameras are also targeted more at the experienced photographer, thus requiring far more manual control over the camera.Again, there is nothing wrong with a critical review, but I have to be critical of SJ's review itself.Nothing personal.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: M. Heintz
Reviews.Content: I have been a serious amateur photographer for more than 20 years and have a large collection of cameras for my photography needs.  I recently purchased my S1500 while traveling in Asia over the past couple of weeks.  I decided to leave my DSLR behind on this trip and had only packed my point-and-shoot.  After a few days, I realized that I needed more camera to capture the sights of Singapore, Indonesia and Australia.  The Fuji S1500 seemed to fit the bill and was a comparable price in Singapore to purchasing it here in the USA and had the zoom capabilities and other features I wanted in a compact camera.First use:I took the camera out for a walking tour in Singapore and captured some great shots in both SR Auto and P mode.  Focus is sharp and the colors are great.  OK, so with outdoor daytime shots working, I thought I would try some night shots.I went to the top of the Swissotel in Singapore at night for some night landscape shots.  I placed the camera on the ledge against the window (to avoid the reflections), set it to SR Auto and used the 2 second self-timer, then pressed the button and stepped back.  I got some stunning photos of the Singapore skyline at night (including the Singapore Flyer).Full test:I put the camera to full use in Sydney where I took nearly 400 photos.  I took some great handheld photos of the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge during the morning.  I also tried the in camera panorama.  I got a great shot that includes the bridge, opera house and botanical gardens.  I could have done the same thing in Photoshop, but hey, why not let the camera do it for me.We then hopped onto one of the open top bus tours (a bit cold as it is winter in Sydney), but still fun.  Even with the bounce of the bus, I was able to get some great pictures with this camera thanks to the Dual IS feature.  The zoom also helped a lot as the bus didn't always get as close as I would have liked.Final stop was the botanical gardens.  I took some good macro shots that rival those I have taken with my EOS Digital SLR.  It is important to note that you don't zoom in Macro mode.Final thoughts:This is not a replacement for a DSLR.  However, if you are looking for more power in a travel / vacation camera than is offered by traditional 3x point-and-shoot models, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: An Overlooked Beauty for an Astounding Price
Reviews.Author: Gregory Wood
Reviews.Content: As an overall package, this camera is simply astounding. Besides a few minor flaws, you get a nearly perfect, highly versatile camera with a fairly expansive feature set and good image quality for less than $200. What more can you ask for? Well, there are a few things, but let me first start with the pros...+ Excellent price. Obviously, getting this kind of technology for less than $200 is a rare find. Fuji somehow keeps prices at the low end of the spectrum, while managing to maintain quality.+ Good construction. This thing feels solid, and fits nicely in the hands. I don't have any qualms about apparent quality or cheapness; for $200, you'd be hard-pressed to find something with comparable materials and build quality.+ Large feature set. The feature set really is as expansive as the description says. As mentioned before, some of them aren't quite as good as they sound, but that will be discussed next. I'm not a even nearly a professional photographer, and I'm certainly still learning, but the upgrade from a 'normal' point-and-shoot is significant. Shutter and aperture priority modes are excellent, as is the full-manual mode. Automatic modes are just your normal automatic modes, with the exception of the SP 'scene selection' mode, which offers some nice settings if you find yourself in a hurry to get a shot or are unsure of how to compose a picture yourself. Fortunately, with the versatile manual modes, you'll find yourself using automatic modes less and less as you become more comfortable with the settings.+ The zoom is great, as is the stabilization system. 12x zoom is more than enough for most realistic applications- if you need any more than that on a regular basis, you should really be looking at an SLR system anyways. When you get up to the 8x-12x range, you'll likely need a small tripod or something to set the camera on, or a very fast shutter speed, but that's pretty standard- no amount of stabilization can accommodate fully for a 12x zoom.+ Super-macro mode takes some astounding close-ups. By far, this is my favorite mode.+ Image quality, for $200, is superior. Although I have seen sharper images, they are usually coming from highly sophisticated SLR systems- not exactly what you'd call comparable.+Speed, although not great, is good enough to keep up with demands from normal photographers. There's a small, but noticeable, amount of shutter lag- nothing that will detract from your photographic endeavors. Time between shots seems to be on par with most other digital cameras of the class. With the right settings, you'll be able to capture most images with reasonable success.The negatives:-Autofocus. This can be sloppy sometimes, failing to focus or focusing incorrectly. Although this might be due to my inexperience, I often find myself wishing for a manual focus. Then again, that's just something you have to deal with when you forego spending thousands of dollars on an SLR system.-Lens. Although it's normally fine, I sometimes find myself wishing for a larger aperture and/or shutter speed range. The shutter speed range of 8-1/2000 seconds is usually more than fast enough, but I do find myself sometimes unable to compose a shot correctly because of a lack of aperture range. 99% of the time this has no relevance outside of extreme low-light or high-light imagine that as I become more competent with the settings, this issue will become less pronounced.-Unusable features. This is one of my biggest peeves with the camera. Sure, it's great to offer ISO 6400, but why bother when any pictures taken in that mode inevitably end up as nothing more than a noisy mess? I appreciate the attempt on Fuji's part, but I would have rather had them dedicate the resources to extra shooting modes, a faster lens, a better lens cover, or any number of other, more practical aspects. Don't get me wrong- most of the features are fine. Just don't try to shoot anything above ISO 800, and don't expect high-quality video.Overall, despite a few downfalls, this is an exceedingly pleasing camera, and one that I feel is often overlooked in the Mega-Zoom discussion solely because of the Fuji name. Nonetheless, this camera can easily compete with almost any other camera of the `SLR-like' class, regardless of brand- and the price is certainly right. Invest the $200 in this wonderful little package of technology, and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: A good nice size camera with high end features.
Reviews.Author: Buzzzmike "buzzzmike2"
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews posted about this gem, and have a few responses (Omitting mechanical breakage issues):1.  Video?  You want a video camera, buy a video camera.  All in ones tend to not have top notch videos. Those that are good, are snippets, and not full blown videos.2.  READ THE INSTRUCTIONS, FOLKS!  Lighting issues (incandescent, florescent, etc.) are taken care of in all high end cameras by changing the lighting source.  Problem solved.3.  For the price and features, this is a top notch buy. I hughly recommend. I have a Nikon D80 SLR and lugging it around is a chore, unless I am going out to do some local shooting. Vacations? Too heavy, nothing screams "tourist" like a large SLR! And subjec to theft, too.4.  Interchangeable lenses? Filters?  This is NOT an SLR! Want those features? Ante up a few more hundred and get one of the top names - Nikon, Canon, etc.  This is above the small point and shoots and below the full blown, large, cumbersome, SLR's!And, I agree with one reviewer about people who complain about every thing in a product. Too many valid complaints, the manufacturer will soon know them, and the product won't sell.  The price and features are outstanding. I am experinced photographer and like the size and feature.I can confidently recommend this prosumer camera.  Maybe it doesn't fit in your shirt or pants pocket, but then again, it's not weighting down your neck!

Reviews.Content: This is my most favorite camera out of all the cameras I had. I previously owned a Polaroid T737 and it has so many problems.I love the automatic scene recognition. Reviews.Title: Wow! Way more than I expected
Reviews.Author: Nikwax
Reviews.Content: My background: I bought my first SLR camera in 1966 (for $90, a handsome sum at that time), before that my cameras were whatever I could get my hands on. I did a fair amount of darkroom work and still have my darkroom equipment in the basement. I've owned a series of Canon SLR cameras, and switched to a Minolta DLSR several years ago. I love my Minolta, I chose it over Canon and Nikon gear because I liked the way it feels and operates: it handles like a traditional film camera and less like a computer. I like dials rather than joysticks and multi-layered menus. And it is a tank: my outfit takes up a good sized backpack and it is quite heavy, and rough handling has landed it in the shop twice. So of course, I've needed a small camera to carry around. In the past we've had Canon A series compact cameras, which have had impressive features and take very good pictures, but the last two we had were very unreliable and we ended up giving them away. I do mostly nature photography, some of which is macro work, though I have done some portrait work as well.I've spent a good deal of time and thought searching for my current small camera. I want good build quality and good feel in the hand (the last being very subjective, of course). I want manual and semi-manual controls (aperture/shutter priority modes), I need a good macro mode, and I need exposure compensation to handle tricky backlit subjects. I looked at some fairly expensive cameras (e.g., Canon S90 and G11, which even at $400 and $500 respectively have their faults). And being unwilling to spend nearly $1000 on a 4/3 camera (which are impressive but still have their issues), I decided to see what an inexpensive camera could do. A friend has a earlier version of the S1500 and she takes very impressive nature photos. Much of my shooting is nature photos, and I loved the form factor of the S1500, so I thought I'd take a chance on it and ordered from Adorama through Amazon.I'm only a few hours into my S1500 experience, but so far I'm very impressed with this camera. The manual control that I want is there. Autofocus functions pretty much the same as it does on my Minolta, and I was pleased to find several autofocus options. I love the hand grip and the big dial on top. The contents of the display are great, I love the histogram, EV, and exposure info. I just took a panorama shot and the assistant works very well. Changing the ISO setting is very convenient. Everything I want to do is right there at hand, I don't need to drill down through menus to find things. I have large hands and don't like small fiddly controls. I like having a lens cap, as the external shutters that many cameras have are a typical point of failure in my experience. The electronic viewfinder is a pleasant surprise and easily turned on and off (same button as the LCD display).  The manual is very good. I didn't test the included software, but the S1500 worked perfectly with my Mac and iPhoto.Add ons: two sets of high capacity (2500mAh or so) rechargeable AA Nickel Metal Hydride (NiMH) batteries and charger (Sony has a nice setup). Some sort of carry case (I'm using a hip bag). A media card (I picked up a 4 GB card for under $15).One thing I would like to see in a small camera is some sort of manual focus that works. The S1500 lacks manual focus, but it does have AF lock, so you can focus on something the same distance as your subject, lock the focus, and then take your picture. This is actually faster and more reliable than some manual focusing systems. AF is difficult even for expensive cameras, so don't expect miracles.Unless you are paying top dollar for a camera (we're talking four figures), there are always some compromises in the design. The manufacturer puts their money into some things and puts less into other things. My wife owns a really nice Panasonic travel zoom. Wow, what a lens on that thing! An amazing lens and a lot of automation, perfect for her, but not for me, no manual control. With the S1500, I'd say this is a camera that can keep an advanced photographer happy and impressed by the value. It is not a compact camera, as the lens and handgrip are prominent, and not lightweight (thanks to 4 AA batteries). I have no idea how a beginning photographer would respond to this camera, but I would say that if you want to learn about the photography, this could be an excellent camera.General comments: all cameras, film and digital, are limited in low light situations. Film behaves badly when it reaches its limits (grain, false color, etc), and digital sensors behave badly as well (pixelation, false color, etc.). Turning the ISO setting higher on a digital camera only amplifies the information coming from the sensor, and as small cameras have tiny sensors, turning up the ISO setting will degrade the image markedly. Don't be surprised when pictures taken at ISO 400 or above have image defects. This situation is made much worse by high megapixel designs: asking for more information out of the same sensor size equals degraded images. A 12 megapixel compact camera has the same size sensor as a 10 or 8 or 6 megapixel camera. Marketing departments would have us believe that more pixels equals better pictures, but the opposite is more likely to be true (note that manufacturers are lowering pixel counts now).  A larger sensor is the only solution to better low light performance, which means a larger and more expensive camera.I'm very excited by this camera and looking forward to working with the S1500.

Reviews.Title: It would not work
Reviews.Author: Kyra Storm
Reviews.Content: I had a Fuji S700 camera and I LOVED it.  I took it everywhere, I wound up taking over 6000 pictures in a year and a half.  I wanted to upgrade it for the S1500 because I wanted a better optical zoom.The features of the S1500 were very nice and I took almost 300 pictures the first week I had it.  I downloaded the pictures onto my computer the same way I did with my S700.  No difference.Then came the problems.  The next time I tried to take pictures I got a "Write Error" message.  I tried to download the pictures I had already taken, but they wouldn't download.  When I tried to play them on the camera I got a "?Read Error" message (supposedly with the question mark in front it means a camera error).  I thought maybe the memory card was bad, so I went and bought another one.  The same thing happened.I tried all sorts of trouble shooting.  I formatted the card before taking pictures.  I only used the FinePix Viewer to download the pictures and made sure to disconnect the camera with that program.It kept happening.I called Fuji.  No one ever answered.  The phone rang and rang and rang and rang.  I finally figured my camera was defective.  I sent it back to Amazon and they sent me another (really loving their returns dept).To be safe, I went and bought another new memory card, because in the manual it said that disconnecting the camera before it was time or trying to download to large of a file may hurt the card.  I also noticed that the manual said large memory cards may not be able to be read by the camera and they suggested using a memory card reader.  This advice was backed up on several forums I found where other people had similar problems.So I bought a memory card reader too.First batch, no problems, came out beautifully.Second batch...SAME THING!!! The pictures won't download.  This time, I even tried 3 different computers with my new memory card reader and card.  Same thing over and over again.I once again tried to call Sony with no luck.Now that I have 2 8GB memory card, 1 4GB memory card and a memory card reader, I have almost as much money invested to have bought another camera.  I have sent this camera back to Amazon again and asked for a refund.Due to Fuji's terrible customer service I have to say I will not recommend a Fuji camera to anyone ever again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: P. Herman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my office because the little point and shoot we have is not taking good enough pictures at events.I choose this one because of the number of features you get for the price point. We've had it at work for a couple of weeks and we're still figuring out all the features. There are a lot.I liked it so well that I bought one for myself at home. I just got it a few days ago and have been practicing how to use it. I especially like the anti-shakiness feature and the fact that if I want to take it out to the desert to walk my dogs, I have zoom without having to carry extra lenses. I love it. I'm very happy with the pictures I've been taking with it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera at a fantastic price!
Reviews.Author: J. Robinson
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the features of an SLR, you're not going to like this camera.  But if you're comparing it with traditional point and shoot cameras, you'll find that it holds it's own.My favorite feature is the macro modes.  With this feature you can get very, very close to the object and still retain focus.I'm not a professional photographer.  I wouldn't even say it's a hobby of mine.  But I do like to take the occasional picture.  After getting this camera I found myself wandering around taking pictures of everything --- up close, far away.I have zero complaints about this camera as it has more features than I expected it to.I wish that the camera had a removable lense that would allow me to attach different lenses.  However, most point-and-shoot cameras don't allow the lense to be changed so this isn't truely a negative for this camera.I also wish I could capture the images in RAW formate.  The internal memory and memory card have plenty of room, but this just isn't an option.  I still don't consider this a negative as the JPGs it produces are beautiful.I have entered a couple amature photography contest with this camera.  Of the 6 that I have entered so far, I have taken first place twice, and have come in second place 3 times.  That says quite a lot about the camera when it's pictures are holding up against high end Canon Digital SLR based cameras!Highly recommend and would definitely buy this camera again!

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera
Reviews.Author: April D. Cotton "AprilthePhotomaniac"
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this camera because my Minolta Dimage Z6 just pretty much fell apart on me.  I have rubber bands holding it together and it still works but I had to replace it.  So, I decided to go with Fugi because my mom has one and she loves it.  I got this better one though.  I haven't gotten to take enough pictures with it yet but I've taken several and I'm very satisfied with it.  It uses my 4gb SD cards very well.  It takes great pictures indoors and out.  Even in darker unlit areas it takes great photos unlike my other camera.  I've also taken about 5 movies ranging from water parks to my playful puppies.  The movies are very clear and clean.  My other camera took lousy movies.  I have also put those movies on a dvd to view on my big screen television and it's perfect!  I take photos for friends and have photographed several indoor weddings/parties and I plan on using this camera for that and everyday photography.  My other camera had trouble with florescent lights and this one seems to work quite well for that too.  So I am very happy with this camera and it seems structurally designed well, so maybe it won't fall apart like my other older camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: MnMMom3
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for just over a month.  My son was graduating from eighth grade and my old camera broke.  I was looking for a good zoom camera for the lowest price.  I could not be happier.  I took awesome pictures of my son's graduation.  We went to an indoor water park the next day and I could not believe the pictures that I was able to take.  The zoom worked great, the color was unbelievable and the action shots were spot on.

Reviews.Title: Great all-around camera
Reviews.Author: Clark E. Hodges
Reviews.Content: After owning the Fujifilm s700 model for over a year, I thought I would upgrade and purchase the newer s1500. $159 w/free shipping! How could I resist? Anyway, it is several steps up from the s700 model. 10 megapixels, 12 power optical zoom, a really rapid high-speed shooting feature, good quality video capture, long battery life and high quality photos make this a no-brainer. The down side is that you are limited to a low-range of aperture settings (you CAN'T set your aperture at f16 for example) in any of the "manual" or "aperture/shutter" modes. This prevents you from getting extreme depth-of-field shots. The panorama mode is great. Very easy to use for great, super-wide shots. This camera, unlike the s700, cannot use add-on filters or attachments because of the un-threaded lens. I went back to my s700 to be able to use polarizers, a lens hood, etc., (46mm threads on the s700). The ability to use high-capacity cards is not a reason to purchase this camera unless you want to keep an un-manageable number in the memory. I find that a 2 gig card holds MORE than enough shots at the top-quality setting for my purposes. Video does not link each clip together, but keeps them as separate images. You must, therefore, review them one at a time. But, this is not a primary video machine, just a high-featured digital still camera that can also shoot video (like virtually all others on the market). I prefer shooting thru the viewfinder, but the lack of a diopter adjustment requires that I use reading glasses to see the image properly. All-in-all, this is a fine piece of equipment for all but the most demanding user. It will do everything a camera should do, and give you the option of many entertaining (but not essentially practical) features to play around with. Keep your ASA settings on AUTO400 or lower for best quality and set your sharpness setting on "hard", because the normal setting is a little soft. The "hard" setting is not too sharp (on my camera at least) but check out your images to make sure. It's a great point and shoot with the ability to do professional work as your skills develop. Oh, Fuji, PLEASE include a FULL manual and stop with the downloadable one! If you're not near your computer and you need to review an advanced function, you're lost! Anyway, after doing a lot of research, I have NOT found a camera that can compare to this one feature-for-feature at even twice the price! If you want less features and can deal with 7.1 megapixels, then the older s700 is, also, a GREAT choice.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE MY CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Megan Sievers
Reviews.Content: I searched long and hard for the perfect camera to capture our family's memories.  For several weeks I looked at camera's and just didn't want to settle on one I was not in love with.  Then I found this Fujifilm Finepix!  It has not only captured the quick pictures of my kids playing and running around, but it has also been so wonderful to take family pictures and pictures of our summer vacations.  I recommend this wonderful camera to anyone and everyone...and for the price...you just CAN'T beat it!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera - cannot ask for more
Reviews.Author: S. P. SISTA "sreenivasa"
Reviews.Content: Note: This review is after a 15 day use of this camera, which I purchased from Amazon.Amazon shipping was great. Amazon indicated that the price was $169. However, when I added to the cart, the price changed to $173. I wanted to buy a camera because my old camera died. Thus, I bought it even though I had to pay a little more.I wanted to have a nice camera with 10x zoom. I could not afford a DSLR. Thus, I compromised with this ultra zoom camera. Even though the reviews on the web were decent enough, I was worried about going for Fuji S1500. I was wrong. The camera came, I loaded the 8GB SD card I purchased and the alkaline batteries that came with it.* The first photo of my daughter indicated the goodness of the flash and the great pictures this camera could take* Camera grip is great. I felt that the build is solid.* For all simple features, this camera is easy to use. The button positions make it easy to configure the most frequently used (by me) functions/features.* It would have been nice if a camera bag was included. None of my digicam bags take this camera. I have to buy a new one !* The camera came with 4 Panasonic alkaline batteries. I've already taken 180+ pictures using the electronic view finder; the batteries are still going strong.* The EVF is good. At higher zooms EVF view appears to be noisy. However, the photos look good.* Looks like the image stabilization is working - never seen a blurred picture due to camera shake :)

Reviews.Title: WoW It Works !
Reviews.Author: B. Harker
Reviews.Content: After looking at reviews and comparing and also was able to look at this in the retail store.  I did purchase it. It is doing great! What I was needing/wanting. Plus more. Still figuring out a few of the extras. Those that I don't use often, I forget all I am suppose to do. Picture quality has been great.  I really like the zoom and continous still pics that catch motion that would otherwise be too quick. Otherwise the single shot still has a bit of delay that seems to come with digital.  I've been using it about 6 weeks.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Donald Bourassa
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on a recent vacation and got some great pictures of moose and bear. The stabilization feature keeps the objects in focus. The panarama feature is worth  the cost of the camera. Manual features are numerous so the advanced owner can takevaried shots in low-light, etc.

Reviews.Title: Deal of the century
Reviews.Content: I shopped around a long time before choosing this camera. Compared to other offerings from the big names, this camera has a big sensor and glass lense for clear photos, all of the manual options in addition to the automatic ones, and it is a nice size. I though that I would miss the rechargeable battery of my old Nikon, but in reality, I don't miss the tyranny of the rechargeable battery. I always had to plug it in the second that I was done with it, and if I forgot then it was dead the next time that I wanted to use it.The LCD is big and bright. I have the image quality set to max and I out in a 12GB card. The pictures are 5mb each, but they transfer very quickly to my MacBook - if there are only a couple I have to check to see if it worked because they are done so fast. I can't get over how well this camera takes photos. There are a lot more features than I realized, too. It is good to read the book when you get the camera. I really like that the flash doesn't automatically pop up if it is dark. The Nikon flash would pop up and I would have to manually change the flash mode to off if I wanted natural light. This camera informs you that your photos might be blurry because it is going to have to step the shutter speed down so much, but you get to pick if you want the flash. If you do, you just push a little button to pop it up. If you don't, you just shoot the photo. Great. I think this camera can do everything for you, but doesn't try to hold your hand and tel you that it knows best.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value & customer service
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Swanson
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed photography since childhood and have been a serious amateur for the last 20 years.  Being disabled now I could no longer afford or handle a DSLR.  I bought the S1500 as it has all the bells & whistles of other much more expensive super zoom cameras.  It's 10 mp, 12 X zoom, manual shutter/aperture control, macro and super macro modes were all features I wanted.  I was a Fuji fan already as I had taken many many photos of my son's first 5 years with a Fuji point & shoot with great results.  I have taken several dozen  photos with the S1500 and have been very happy with the results.  It is a solid well built camera and all though I am now used to using a viewing screen it is nice to have the option of looking through the viewfinder. Other than manual focus there is very little I would hope for, especially at this price.  I also want to share my buying experience with Amazon.  When my camera arrived I could not get it to work properly.  After 2 calls to Fuji they said it was a software problem and that I should return it to Amazon.  I have bought many things from Amazon but never had to return anything.  Being a bit old school I much prefer to handle these things over the phone with a fellow human being rather than by e-mail.  It took just a bit of looking to find the customer service phone number and make the call.  A mechanical voice informed me that I would receive an immediate call back which seemed a tall order.  Sure enough, within 10 seconds a customer service rep called and in less than 5 minutes I had a return shipping label and a new camera shipped and set to arrive in 72 hours.  The rep could not have been any better.  He was apologetic, professional and really made a wonderful effort to get the problem resolved quickly, which it was.  The new camera is perfect and I am now an even a bigger fan of Amazon than I was.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: S. Linnemeyer
Reviews.Content: I have bought Canon and Sony cameras/camcorders that were more expensive and not half as good.  I also love the build in panorama feature.  It may not be a shirt pocket camera, but it is still a small and light enough to carry it around my neck comfortably.  I like the 12X optical zoom and the 10 mega pixels.  It takes great video as well.  The only thing I wish was that the self timer was a button I could push like it was on the FinePix s700, rather than something I have to find on the shooting menu.

Reviews.Title: A good product for the money
Reviews.Author: P. W. Head
Reviews.Content: The camera has alot of great features like the videos, the panorama feature linking multiple photos, and the multi rapid shot feature. The camera will change from the view screen on the back of the camera to a view window with the touch of a button that works great in bright light when it is hard to see the larger screen. The camera takes high quality photos but you have to allow the camera time to focus by pushing the button down part way briefly or you will get blurry pictures. The camera is bulkier in size the the standard point and shoot. You can't slip it into your pocket. I bought a small camera case with a neck strap. The required lense cap is a slight inconvenience, but after a while seems pretty insignificant. The flash is very bright, and I've found that I need to be 10 feet or more away from the subject when I use it or it brightens things too much. Battery life is exceptional, but it does take 4 AA. The pixview software that comes with the camera is ok, but I liked my HP software more. Overall, a good camera that takes photograpy a step above the smaller point and shoot cameras because of many of the features. It reminds me of when I used to use a 35mm camera because of its size, lense cap, and features.

Reviews.Title: good camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Thew "Thew"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for my Fuji s700, and I'm absolutely torn on it. I absolutely love the photo quality, the ease of use, the functionality and ergonomics, and the many features packed into the camera.  I also miss having a solid lens where i could attach my many various filters...I would recommend this camera, or any of the Fuji line of finepix, to virtually any amateur photographer. They are all very simple to set up and use. it takes less than five minutes from opening the camera to having batteries and an sd card installed, and the settings adjusted. then the fun begins. These cameras are perfect for the amateur photographer, the hobbyist, the vacationers, and almost everyone in between.  Even some professional/semi pro photographers would make great use of them: my mother(semi professional photographer), and her husband(a photography instructor) both have used the s700 and have some truly amazing pieces.  With a multitude of functions, including an option to take panoramic shots (you take 3 consecutive photos, and the camera does its best to merge them side to side to side...), you will most likely fall in love with this camera. It is about the size of a standard 35mm, so not recommended for a jeans pocket, but still not so large as to be generally cumbersome.  The zoom on this camera is fantastic, I use mine primarily for long distance landscape shots, and they all turn out surprisingly well.  If you are looking for closer pictures, the macro and super macro settings work equally impressively. The only thing I've found that these cameras are not top notch on is high speed shooting~they do lag a bit more than some of the competition! If you are looking for great action shots, I'd recommend a Nikon or similar.My only complaints about this camera, and they all stem from owning the s700 previously, are  the removal of some of the photo settings(the fireworks setting on the s700 was one of the best I've ever come across!), and the switch from a solid external lens to a telescoping lens.  The former of these two would not have taken much to include in the software on the camera, and the latter has multiple drawbacks for me. I personally prefer a solid external lens for a plethora of reasons that most people won't think twice about. A telescoping lens is definitely more practical in terms of storage size, but I'm more concerns with the risks of getting dust inside the mechanics, and I will greatly miss being able to simply screw on a polarized lens, a colored filter, or the option of adding a telephoto lenses.All said and done, so far this is a good camera, and i do intend to continue using the Fuji Finepix line of cameras for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Good for pics, video a lil flawed
Reviews.Author: thebrotherofasis
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. It's easy to use, and even though small, very powerful.The only complaint I have is about its video recording sound. The zoom is really a bit noisy, so when zooming in or out while capturing video, noise will appear in the video due to zooming.However, it is a product with outstanding quality in terms of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera even for amateur photographers
Reviews.Author: Christian Edmondson
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera for the price, and even beginner photogs can leverage the advanced features in this camera.This is the first crossover DSLR/pocket digital camera I have ever owned, and it has produced the best pictures of any digital camera I have purchased.  (When I say "crossover", I mean that it is not really a DSLR camera but it has numerous features found on, and produces pictures as good as, many of the entry-level DSLR cameras.)  At 10mp, it gives you as much detail as you will ever need for everyday pictures.  The LCD screen on the back is big, and works well even in sunlight.  You can also use the viewfinder if the sun is so bright that the LCD is not usable, which is an option you won't find in many of the pocket digital cameras these days.  The image stabilization is fantastic, especially if you find yourself shooting most of your pictures freehand as I do.The shooting modes give you a lot of flexibility.  The auto mode will do everything for you...all you need to do is focus and shoot.  Now there is not really a "focus" per-se, but when you find the center of your shot and hold the shutter button halfway down, it allows the camera to perfectly adjust and lock-in the autofocus before you click down the shutter button to execute the picture.  There is also a panoramic mode, a movie mode, a fully manual mode, as well as other pre-programmed modes.The zoom on this camera is excellent.  It allows you to get great close-ups when you are fairly far away from your subject.  I have found it to be excellent when shooting sports pictures from the sidelines, allowing me to get close enough to see facial expressions of the players on the field.Although the camera does come with software that will assist you in downloading the pictures from the camera to your computer, I have found it is much easier to just pop out the SD card and have my computer read the SD card directly.  This brings up what I consider to be the only shortcoming of this camera, which is the battery placement.  The SD card slot and the battery compartment, in the same location, are under a small access door on the bottom of the camera.  To get at the SD card or the batteries, you will need to have a flat stable surface to set the camera onto.  That being said, it's not that big a deal.  I have changed the batteries twice in the field, and if you have everything at hand (or if you have someone that will lend you a hand for a moment) you can change the batteries without setting the camera down.  It's just a little awkward.Overall this is a superb camera.  For the price I do not believe you will find a better camera.  To get better pictures and more features, you would have to jump to a true DSLR.  A note about the S1500's replacement, the S1800...the S1800 is due out in a few weeks, and it may be worth the wait.  The S1800 will cost about $50 more than the S1500, but you will get a lot of bang for that $50.  Better zoom, larger LCD, 12mp instead of 10mp, 720p HD movie capture, as well as many more new features.  If the S1500 is this good, I can hardly wait for the S1800!

Reviews.Title: Finepix S1500
Reviews.Author: Craig A. Soderland
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an upgrade to the various point and shoot pocket format cameras that we have in 10-12 MP. The major problem with all of them was how and where they worked. Some took fabulous day shots, but now so good at night. Others took good day shots and would have taken good night shots except the flash washed everything out.SO we opted for a Optical zoom, and a big objective lens, for the light gathering. indoors under normal lighting the flash is not necessary for most things.As a camera it fits nicely in between the DSLR and the pocket point and shoots. Price wise it fits nicely in the pocket point and shoot range where most of it's competition is closer to the DSLR's. The only thing that comes close is the Nikon, and Nikon cheaped out on the lensing and made up for it in the software.The only two complaints I have with it are:1. having to read the manual. You can take good pictures without having done so, but if you read it you can take great pictures, there are allot of options and settings and it really matters that you pick the right mode for the shots you are taking.2. I wish Fuji would have allowed the attachment of some kind of filter. Attaching a UV filter for overcast days would have been a big boon or even a polarizer. And as an added benefit you'd get that extra level of protection for your lens.Other than that It does what we bought it for flawlessly, which is take fantastic pictures of a perpetual motion toddler who has only one speed Dead-Run. (and usually coming straight at you when you try to take a portrait.)

Reviews.Title: Lot's of features for a low price
Reviews.Author: John Lundholm
Reviews.Content: This was the lowest price camera that met at the requirements for a college photography class (aperture and shuttle priority primarily, and some other feature). Very happy with ease of use, picture quality and zoom. Probably is more than was a casual use might need, but if you want to start doing some creative shooting, it's a great camera to start with.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for vacations/birding
Reviews.Author: SLH1078
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for my Fuji Finepix S1000 after I damaged its LCD screen beyond repair.  I like this camera because it is compact and has a lot of features.  I love the image stabilization and 12x optical zoom for birding.

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA I EVER HAD!!
Reviews.Author: Gwendolyn Serrano "Gwen Serrano"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for my birthday in August...then I only used it for about 3 weeks before a "Friend" stole it from my house!! So we purchased another one the following month.. Now I have had it for about 4 months!! I must say this is by far the BEST camera I have ever owned!! Being I worked in the Photo department before I knew what to look for in a good camera and well Fuji is a very good maker of cameras. People always think Kodak but Fuji really is one of the best!! So with this camera being 10mp, 10x's optical zoom and Fuji those three things are what sold it to me for the deal!! I love to take pictures and the pictures this camera takes are breathtaking! It's amazing how crystal clear the pictures are! It's easy to learn how to use, has great options for settings right on the top, takes regular AA batteries that makes it easy to change fast and keep shooting! I would recommend this camera to anyone who loves to take many pics and scenic pictures. The zoom is wonderful!! No need to get close to get a clear image..just ZOOM! This camera is easily worth the money paid!! The only thing that I miss is that having a smaller camera before this I could fit it in my purse.. This one you cant. Its a lil bigger and you would need a camera bag. It's not a small camera to just put in a pocket. It's quite bigger but totally worth it if you know about camera's and the specs you will see how this is worth it even if you can't just shove it into your pocket!! Just use the camera strap and hang it around your neck and your ready to snap!!!

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: John Skinner "Gadget"
Reviews.Content: Years ago when the Finepix 3800 first came out, I purchased it to find it was a great camera in all respects except that it could not focus in low light.  Well, I am very happy to report, the S1500 has taken care of this problem.  And Amazon was very helpful in fulfilling my order in a very quick manner!  Amazon Prime is Great!  It is a really good camera!!  I can not lay out the cash wanted for a Canon or Nikon.  They are very pricey because of their name.  The S1500 takes great pictures & video!!  There may be "cons" to some, but I find it takes excellent pictures & video without even trying.  It is very intuitive; easy to operate.  I am very pleased to have been able to purchase it for only $165 thru Amazon, when I paid over $350 for the 3800 when it first came out.  So it does not have a flash shoe or a 24x zoom.  If I need that kind of pic, I'll get out my Canon AE-1. You can not go wrong with the S1500.  Oh ya, My 8 year old granddaughter loves the 3800 she now has!

Reviews.Title: FinePix Software Not User Friendly
Reviews.Author: J. Hartigan
Reviews.Content: While the camera is great, the FinePix softeware, which is included with the camera, is awful.  It is not user friendly.  Here are just a few negatives: When you print more than one picture per page you can not arrange the pictures on the page where you would like to pint them.  This is done by the software, where the software want to print the pictures is what you get. Once you have inserted a text message and saved it to a picture, you can not delete, or correct the text.  You can not print the listing of all the pictures with their specs.  Fuji should license the Camedia software from Olympus and get rid of the FinePix software.  I feel this software is a major draw back.

Reviews.Title: You can't get a better camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Lowell "Formerly Famous"
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Fuji Finepix cameras, and have sold previous models as I have purchased newer ones with better features. This model S1500 replaces my S1000. It is basically the same camera, but has a slightly larger LCD screen. It advertises better image stablization features. I am just learning some of the settings. It has a higher ISO setting that you can use for extremely low light shooting, but you sacrifice picture quality, producing only a 3 megapixel image when shooting above 1600 ISO to 3200. I cannot find any camera that shoots this quality of picture for the low price. The only Fuji Finepix I have ever had a problem with was my S1000, which died on me a few weeks ago. I hope the quality of the construction of this camera is better. So far, so good! The zoom capability is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: jaww "gymnist grandma"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the S1500 Fuji Digital Camera. It is a really good camera. It takes great pictures. My granddaughter Is a gymnist and we take lots of pictures. The features are easy to use.I had the model S700 before this one and I wanted one just like it I had great service from amazon.com. I didn't know we could order anything other than books from Amazon. The website was easy to use and I received it when you said it should be here. Thank You

Reviews.Title: Good Investment
Reviews.Author: Andrew Edwards
Reviews.Content: As soon as I received my Fujifilm camera, I was impressed. I originally had a 6.1 mp camera, this camera blow my old one out of the water.  So much faster and clearer picture.  It is easy to hold, having big hands.  Many different kinds of settings that I haven't previously seen on other cameras.  It was a good decision on my part to purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds all expectations for the price!
Reviews.Author: namelocbob
Reviews.Content: Very pleased. Great pictures even at low light. Takes awesome night shots and fireworks. Great features with continuous mode and shutter speed is dead on. I am ordering another one in about five minutes for a gift to my cousin.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: leelani
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of features and it's so well designed that they are easy to use.  I haven't quite figured out how to take closeups with completely blurred background but I've had lots of other successes.  Batteries seem to last pretty well.  A lot of fun to use!

Reviews.Title: Really bad quality images... Is not a good option
Reviews.Author: Jairo Nunez "Alejofly"
Reviews.Content: In the past i use to have a fujifilm, very good quality cameras; so i decided to change my actual Canon A620 buying the S1500.  I am really disapointed... the quality is really bad... grainy all the time.  ISO settings only can be changed in manual modes.  If you want to change the ISO settings, you must set all the parameters according the conditions every time(dark, bright, cloudy, etc).  The wide automatic scene options the camera has are useless because ISO settings are usually very high (automatic), so the pictures usually are so grainy.  You will need to set the parameters all the time, so buy another camera, because unless you are a professional, you are going to miss a lot of memory moments with this camera.Cheap, nice look, impressive zoom,  but you will pay the price with quality...In addition to the bad quality performance, my camera has a problem when i use the automatic face detection option.  Does not work well, 90% of the time does not find a face, and slow down the performance of the camera, because once you are using it, there is a delay between the shutter button and the shot; more than a half of a second, so the shot usually is not right. I have that AFC option off all the time.

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Digital
Reviews.Author: K. Bentz "Believe you me..."
Reviews.Content: I'm puzzled and dismayed by the bad reviews here, and thanking my lucky stars.  I absolutely adore my Fujifilm FinePix S1500.  Yes, it doesn't do well taking night shots or low light shots. Yes it has a somewhat slow shutter response time.  Both of these were noted in professional reviews I read prior to purchasing this camera.  That being said, I have taken some 9,000 - 10,000 shots with this puppy.  I have it with me EVERYWHERE and have taken some absolutely fantastic shots.I recently upgraded to a Nikon D90, but I still carry my Fujifilm FinePix S1500 with me and have both hanging around my neck and use them in the same photo shoot, but for different things.  I've had a bit of difficulty figuring out the appropriate distance for SuperMacro shots with the Fuji, but that hasn't stopped me from getting some magnificent shots.My biggest complaint with mine is that I simply bought a camera that does not have the capability of doing what I want.  Not the camera's fault.  I walked into this knowing that I would not be able to add/change lenses, and that the zoom is somewhat limited.  With my Nikon, my only limitation is how much lens can I afford, and how heavy is it going to be.But the Fuji has very simple controls that are fairly intuitive and a manual that is easy to read and follow.Man, I'm sorry people have had bad luck with theirs.  Mine is a tried and true friend.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: that_one_guy "me"
Reviews.Content: I just picked up this camera at Radioshack for $129 on clearance.  It has the look and feel of an SLR while maintaining the ease of use of most consumer level point and shoot cameras.  The photos are pretty awesome, and the video quality isn't too bad either.  I would recommend this camera to anyone searching for a cool looking point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix S1500
Reviews.Author: Pnthighnc53
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm Finepix S1500 is a good camera for the price range.I like it's durarbility,picture quality & it's easy to learn & use, also the zoom lens take excellent pictures.The only thing i didn't like was the software didn't download completely.For the money i'm please with my new camera.

Reviews.Title: Finepix s1500 i love it
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: So i had just brought my daughter this camera in early July. She wanted to get in to photography. Everyday she made me & my husband check the mail for it. When she got it she started taking pictures of everything. This is her first camera like this. I must say for the price it`s amazing. my daughter loves it! She shows me all the amazing pictures she takes of our dog. The batteries weren't always good so we brought special camera batteries they last her around 4 weeks. The camera is a bit heavy but she uses the neck holder. The shutter speed is wonderful. The zoom is great but depends on what your zooming in on. She had tried to take a picture of a grasshopper at night with little bit of light and it had came out a little bit blurry but thats not a big deal for me. It's extremely easier to use even me who's very old fashion knows how to use it and we take it on our family vacations! It's more of the family camera then hers. I highly recommend this item to people or teenagers or anyone who wants to start photography it really is an excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Such a Tiny Package
Reviews.Author: Heather T.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few months ago after my old (OLD) Fuji broke.  My budget was very tight ($200 or less), but I needed a camera with great macro abilities.  I do food blogging, so I also wanted one where I could fiddle with the white balance and other settings.  Obviously, finding that kind of flexibility in an inexpensive camera is rare.  Enter FujiFilm S1500!  This teeny tiny point-and-shoot camera is jam-packed with versatility.  There are lots of ways for you to manipulate your photos, but there are also lots of pre-fab settings--like if you're in a museum or outside in the snow.  I have used the 'museum' setting (which also eliminates all noises from the camera), and it worked great.So far, most of my shots come out pretty good.  If there's ample light, the shots come out beautifully.  Occasionally, I feel like the camera inexplicably takes poor photos, even if I'm on the right setting.  But you get what you pay for, right?  Other positives: The battery life is incredible, the macro and super-macro setting are really great, and shots are generally crisp.The negatives: For some reason, this camera is not recognized as an external device by my brand new Mac.  This means I can't just selectively upload pictures/delete pictures as I see fit.  Instead, I have to use the crappy "FinePix Viewing Software" that came with the camera--and trust me when I say that it is truly the most useless software imaginable.  I resent that it's taking up space on my brand new lappy.  Oh, AND--the software makes it so that I cannot upload two different sets of photos in one day without having to rename whichever set is second.  Oh my god, so obnoxious.  But I imagine that's not really the camera's fault.

Reviews.Title: battery cover/door failure
Reviews.Author: camera enthuast
Reviews.Content: i have this camera it works great however about 1 week ago i attempted to open the door to remove the memory card and the clips holding the cover/door close came out in my hands, for such a price why is that door so fragile.Now im faced with the predicament, to get it repaired and who do i go to.

Reviews.Title: Can't complain
Reviews.Author: C. Gilbert "weebit"
Reviews.Content: Having all the different options can cause some to flinch.  But trust me when I say there is a learning curve, and it is well worth you learning how to use the camera.  Before blaming the camera for a bad shot make sure it was the camera's fault.  Don't try to search for great light, or that perfect pose.  Just take the picture.  Experiment. Test. Learn. You will be surprised that you are keeping more, than you are trashing.This is a great camera for those that want a SLR feel.  It is not a SLR camera though.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Camera
Reviews.Author: Rosemary M. Moody "Rosemary bookie"
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera a few weeks and am still learning all the features. It seems to be easy to use and the pictures are very good.  If you are wanting to take quick speed shots this camera is a little slow.  I would recomend this for beginner who wants good photos and an easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. It is easy to switch from still pictures to video.

Reviews.Title: An excellent Point & Shoot that has  great features
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Naujoks "Polkas"
Reviews.Content: I owned an older model of this camera I bought in 2007, used it extensively to take landscape pictures for my wife's painting projects. I accidently dropped it, and had to get a new one - finally, the price dropped right before Christmas. Features I love about this Fuji S1500:  It uses 4 AA batteries and will last a very long time.  The memory chip is in the battery compartment, easy to get out.  It has a 12x optical zoom.  It takes videos that are 640 x 480 lines, can play on a TV set, and with a $14 memory chip, can take over an hour of video.  It is even smaller than the previous model.  I don't use the software that comes with it, rather I load it into a new folder on my computer and work with it on my own software.  One of the negative reviews mentioned trouble getting the pictures off the camera with the FUJI software - I concur with that.The most useful feature is the eyepiece that you can look through - especially when glare prevents you from focusing the camera on the back LCD screen.  That eyepiece is improved on this model.  I shoot about 175 pictures on average each time I use the camera, and it doesn't start red-lighting you to change the batteries.

Reviews.Title: I like this camera
Reviews.Author: Luis M. Gamez Guzman "Luis Gamez"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a ergonomic camera easy to use for my wife and with features similar to DSLR, I used to be a SLR amateur photographer and I am satisfied with this product, it was not so expensive, I have taken beatiful pictures with it. the only problem as many users had said, is the noise while you record a video, the video resolution is poor but is ok, I wanted a camera not a camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L. Owensby "wdw lover"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! We have not been disappointed at all with this purchase. I love that my pictures look so much better. The zoom is incredible. I love all the settings. It's easy to use. I love the continuous shutter feature...we have some great pictures thanks to it. Great value for all the features. You will not be disappointed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Richard Ashwood "COWBOY"
Reviews.Content: I HAD A FUJI SLR BEFORE AND IN SOMEWAYS I LIKED THE FACT THAT IT WAS BULKY.  BUT TRAVELING ON A MOTORYCLE IT WAS A BIT OF A HASSEL TO PUT UP EACH TIME.  THIS CAMERA IS ALMOST HALF THE SIZE AND MORE THEN TWICE THE MEGAPIXELS.  THE ZOOM IS GREAT.  I AM STILL PLAYING WITH IT AND LEARNING SOME OF THE NEW FEATURES.  I LIKE TO TAKE PORTRAIT SHOTS AND LIKE THE SETTING WHERE I CAN DO THAT BUT HOLDING THE CAMERA HORIZONALY.ONE REASON I BOUGHT IT WAS THE VIEW FINDER.  WE HAVE ALL TRIED TO USE A LCD ON A BRIGHT DAY.  THE VIEW FINDER DOES NOT HAVE A FOCUS WHEEL ON IT LIKE THE OLD FUJI BUT ITS SUCH A MINOR ISSUE.  SINCE IT HAS 4 BATTERIES INSTEAD OF TWO I THINK THAT THE BATTERY LIFE IS MUCH BETTER THEN THE SMALLER CAMERAS.  I DID BUY AN 8 GIG MEMORY CARD TO GO WITH IT, NOW IF I CAN JUST TAKE THAT MANY PICTURES.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: E. F. Eisenhauer "flamingo13"
Reviews.Content: This was the lowest price ANYWHERE on the net. It is also the best value for your money.The quality of pix is outstanding; video quality is outstanding.Only problem -- if you can even call it that -- is that it is not exactly user-friendly. It takes awhile to learn how to use, but once you do, it's a snap.As far as pricing, I couldn't beat Amazon's price anywhere. This is a $200 camera, and I got it for $159. That's more than 20% savings!The camera is MILES above anything else I looked at. Non-pros like me can take professional-looking pix. Lots of cool features, and a smart-focus that takes the pressure off you!Buy it! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Nipponkai
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace a FujiFilm S700. This camera is easy to use and takes great pictures under any condition. It is compact and light weight with great features.I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a more traditional camera instead of a simple "point and shoot" digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera in a Small Pakage
Reviews.Author: D. Proctor
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera for anyone that is looking for feathers above a point and shoot camera. I have used the macro and super macro and enjoyed the results of both. Only thing I could say negative about this camera would be the owners manual on disk vs. in a book form, one other draw back(as I see it) is the lack of a threads to attach a filter to the lens. GREAT BANG FOR THE BUCK!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it!!
Reviews.Author: Chocaluvr
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to upgrade from my older Fuji 3MP, 3x optical zoom digital camera and I'm glad to have invested once again in the Fuji brand. I wanted another point-and-shoot camera but with better MP's, zoom, and extra settings that my older camera did not have. This camera did not disappoint me; it will not only give you the option of setting it to auto if you are a beginner but it also gives you the option of using the other settings it comes with to enhance your photos (once you learn how to use them). The setting in micro mode is fantastic enabling you to get close clear, sharp, detailed and colorful photos. And the 12x optical zoom is another great feature. I was pleasantly surprised when I took a photo of a house from my backyard that's two blocks away and the photo came out sharp and clear. I highly recommend this camera; also get a memory card (not included with camera) and some pre-chargeable batteries because you'll be shooting a lot of photos. I've had the camera for over three weeks and have taken over 400 photos and so far have had no problems with the camera. The camera is durable and comfortable to use and for the price, you can't get any better.

Reviews.Title: Most bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Chris Fischesser "barbershop tenor"
Reviews.Content: The Fuji 1500 was recommended by a former photography professor.  It is more intuitive in scene recognition than other more expensive cameras and its 12x optical zoom is hard to beat.  It does have that annoying attribute of most digital cameras that you have to hold the button down to allow it to focus, but the ease of use and other features make this a non issue.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great value but lacks in service
Reviews.Author: Kenneth J. Haynes "silentsam"
Reviews.Content: Have purchased another Fuji camera and was quite pleased with it but was looking for an updated camera, Price was one of the factors in buying this one and the newer options. Camera works fine, is easy to hold and focus and fits well in camera case along with other cameras if this important for users. Battery life I can't attest to as i've not had it long enough to test, However I am crusing in January so i'll give it a good workout. Down side: cd unreadable and there was no memory card included to try out camera and my other memory cards were not compatable but by luck I had a card that would work. Otherwise I would have had to make a trip and find the right one, Downloading to computer did not work at first as the connection to the camera you have to push real hard to make a good connection.Beyond these two gripes I would say that this is a fine camera for the price and ease of use for the average user.As I stated before this is my second Fuji and am quite happy with there products.

Reviews.Title: Hoping for better quality
Reviews.Author: Matthew G. Gobat
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement to an older Fuji I had.  Unfortunately this camera does not have the same picture quaility that my old one had.  The big zoom and high megapixels are great, but the pictures are very grainy.  Video is also disappointing as the audio picks up noises from the camera focusing sometimes being louder then the sounds in the room.  This camera makes me a little sad.

Reviews.Title: just can't beat it!
Reviews.Author: hondo "kidzpstr"
Reviews.Content: This little camera has it all!  Compact, great pictures, super clear viewing screen, panoroma setting is really cool,  even takes awesome videos!  Buy this camera, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Brenda Pink "snorkelgeek"
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous camera for the price.  I purchased this camera becasue I wanted one with more zoom.  My old camera only had 3X zoom and it was frustrating getting some travel shots with only 3X.  The camera is easy to learn, takes good clear pictures, is light in comparison with other similar cameras.  My only complaints are: the zoom is noisy and shows up on the audio of movies taken with this camera, the flimsy little cord connection cover that never seems to move out of the way so you can plug the cord in, the battery cover takes some figuring out to open the first few times.  With the exception of the noisy zoom, these are minor complaints that would not deter me from recommending this camera.

Reviews.Title: It's a winner
Reviews.Author: S. S. Otto "7x70"
Reviews.Content: I have used Fuji cameras for many years. This camera is a real bargain. WalMart has it for $30 more!The improvements in the camera operation and manual make this a good choice for the serious photographer who doesn't want to carry lots of camera but wants big camera results. It is very user friendly with all kinds of manual options to make it do way beyond point and shoot, but it can do it all on Auto if you don't want complications. Look inside my book, All Stories are True...Some Actually Happened, on Amazon to see the quality of the photos

Reviews.Title: Very nice amateur camera!
Reviews.Author: Toni W. Butler Click "AmPhotoGirl"
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with this camera. I bought it so that I could take pics of my son's high school band during performances. One negative thing is the delay between focusing and taking the pic, sometimes I don't get the shot. Also, I don't like that the battery life isn't displayed on the LCD (maybe I could turn this feature on?). I should really read the manual though, I could learn something! All in all, I love my Fuji S1500!Also, it's $30 cheaper at Amazon and ships free... better deal than Walmart had and Amazon wasn't out of stock either (unlike Walmart).

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: S. Viola
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I went ahead and purchased the Fuji S1500. I didn't have it long before going on a trip to the Canadian Rockies. It took great pictures and was easy enough to operate. I got some nice close ups of a roses in a rose garden and great distance shots. I am very happy with the zoom. The only draw back I've found so far is, this particular camera does not appear to like the recharable Nickel Metal Hydrite batteries. But I will try the batteries in something else and see if it is the batteries or camera. Since it also takes Alkaline and Lithium, I haven't tried Lithium but it works fine with Alkaline. For the price this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! Nice Price!
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: Great camera - I bought it for the 12x Zoom and the 1.5 pictures a second continuous shooting. It does everything the description says it does. The only thing that concerns me is the "Zoom in" is noisy - but everything works the way it says in the manual.Also I use Mandriva Linux(instead of Windows or Mac OSX) - it is identified as a PTP USB Camera so gphoto2 and libgphoto2 can download the pictures to a PC running Linux.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm 10MP Camera Captured the Vacation Beautifully
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after borrowing my mother's Fuji 7500 and could not believe the quality of photos it took. You'll be surprised at how nice indoor non-flash photos look. It takes that "Snap shot" look away from these types of photos. The camera is really easy to use. A quick glance over the manual and you'll know where everything is at. Don't bother buying cheap AA batteries for this or you'll be hunting more very soon, but a set of good quality Duracell's will last a very long time. We used it to a trip to Destin and my wife wanted some of those "dressed in white" photos by the beach of our 4 kids. Everybody that has seen them have been amazed at how professional they look. The bad part about that is that we had to buy multi prints for the grand parents, uncles, aunts, god parents... etc!!  Here is a link to some of those shots.[...]The only complaint I have about the camera is that sometimes while reviewing the photos on the camera, the camera locks up and you have to turn it off and then back on to clear it which means you loose your place when viewing the images. Small inconveinence for what this camera can do for under $200. You'll be very happy with the images you get and people will think you where using a $1000 camera to get images so clear.

Reviews.Title: Something of a disappointment
Reviews.Author: eagseags "eagseags"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Very light and compact compared to other superzoom cameras (which is why I was attracted to it). Easy to use. Good zoom.  Relatively inexpensive.  "Burst mode" really is fast.Cons:Picture quality is very poor, poorer than some point-and-shoot cameras. To get halfway good pictures, I have to use the "Program" mode, and force the ISO to 200, and set the "Sharpen mode" to "hard."  Autofocus seems less than accurate. Highlights blown out. Image stabilization seems ineffective.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures
Reviews.Author: Exumaa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an old Nikon. What a treat!! It does everything. We live on a boat and the seascape shots are beautiful. The camera is easy to use. I bought a second one for a gift.

Reviews.Title: Buy anything else
Reviews.Author: Kelly S. Barkoski "popparbark"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with high expectations after reading some glowing reviews,unfortunately the finepix does not measure up,yes the price is low,it has plenty of features,none of which work very well. to let you know i replaced my old kodak 6mp z650 with the fuji and even with a lens scratch the kodak takes better pics, i figured it might take me sometime to learn the fuji but does not take quality focused pics in any setting i can find. i conclude no camera with bad focus is ever a good deal, if you, like my wife and have limited funds do not waste it on this camera, sincerly Raymond c BarkoskiP.S. i have contacted fuji and they are having me return the camera,from discussion with fuji techs they believe it is a faulty camera. i will update when the unit is returned.PPS Camera is at fuji repair and they are replacing the lens should be back sometime next week. If it works i will be happy to change the review, 2/18/10it is now 3/1/10 called fuji for update was told they are waiting for part since i okayed giving me a replacement this is really annoying,after repeating the request they are shipping a replacement today. if this is fuji customer service this is the last fuji purchase i will ever make. camera was rec at fuji 2/2/10 at no point has anyone at fuji made any attempt to contact me regarding the delay.Rec replacement on 03/08/10  will revise after testing this oneAAAARG Someone at fuji must not like me,Have spent the last week trying to take crisp sharp pics with the replacement using auto with beeps and geen lights still very poor focus used the SR and sport,landscape settings etc. all have poor focus even if the lcd shows a good pic the downloaded pics have very poor quality,contacted amazon and was told i have to deal with fuji. recontacted fuji at least this time they are paying the shipping and promise to expedite matters.As it stands now my grandson gets better pics with his fisherprice.a very disappointed Ray Barkoskithe saga continues camera retuned by fuji beginning of april still has the same focus issues,sent sample images to fuji first they denied rec email after resending and asking for confirmation the email made it there. i contact them again and they tell me it is focusing on the background even though it is zoomed in on an object 10 feet away and tried to tell me my kodak sample pic was not taken from the same distance. i pesonally took the pics from the same spot.i have taken by now probably 150 test pis with the old kodak z650 vs the fuji. this is enough that i am sure the fuji has focus issues that fuji will not acknowledge. while i will say the staff at fuji are pleasant the customer service is horrid.if you want average to poor pics this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: P. Melton "imelton2"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I have owned it since January 2010.  It takes AA batteries so I never have to worry about my camera dying and can't do anything about it.  Also, I use Lithium rechargeables that last a really long time.  I've never had any quality issues with my photos.  It fits great in the hands.  I like that the flash only works when I pop it open.  I cannot say enough.

Reviews.Title: A dependable, less expensive pro-type camera
Reviews.Author: Gerald Ferguson
Reviews.Content: This camera has both a large viewing screen and a direct through the lens type eyepiece, just like expensive professional cameras. The zoom lens works smoothly for viewing either way. The photos have been very good, even in less than ideal light. The flash is easy to use, and the batteries are easy to replace, and they are easily available. The photos download simply into my computer.It  can also take short movies. The camera has settings to optimize for different subjects. I have found very dependable, with no quirks.

Reviews.Title: Just as described
Reviews.Author: Sammie
Reviews.Content: I received the camera within a week.  It was just as described with the original box and all accessories.  It works fine.

Reviews.Title: Bad for Photography
Reviews.Author: indie__dancer
Reviews.Content: When I read reviews on this camera, the reviews were outstanding! When I got the camera, it was a different story. The quality is bad for photography but probally good for just family pictures and things of that sort. I was disappointed with the camera and returned it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony Ingersoll
Reviews.Content: This camera is great....especially for the price that I paid for it. We use this on our Paranormal Investigations and were pleased with the quality of the pictures that came out. While I am not a camera expert, this seemed to be doing very good for what it is.

Reviews.Title: Great for beginners
Reviews.Author: Russell Wilcox
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for everyday photos. I have moved on to more advanced picture taking but I really love it.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: diane
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced my Sony Cybershot that wasn't focusing properly, so I was very happy to find a replacement with all the features of this model. I believe I have gotten my money's worth out of this camera though. The pictures are a little warm and hard to get used to after the coolness of the Sony. Still, it's a good all-around camera that I can take when I don't want to carry my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Floyd
