Reviews.Content: I picked mine up at a pay by the pound thrift shop. I think it cost about $0.69.  It didn't work but my husband was able to get the lens unstuck.  Now it works beautifully and has replaced my old digital camera.  I love its versatility, its sleek design, and its story.

Reviews.Title: Great spec's and features, just lousy pictures
Reviews.Author: MikeW
Reviews.Content: I did lots of homework on this camera before I bought it.  It had all the specs and features I wanted, optical viewfinder, full manual options, nice 12X zoom, the works.  Along with a reasonable price.  The only problem is it takes lousy pictures.  They are not sharp, they have kind of a soft focus to them.  Not outright blurry, just not sharp.  And it doesn't handle contrast well, bits of snow or even just light thru trees overwhelms it, you get a larger pure white area than you should.  Other people seem to like it, it may print ok, but not great, but veiwed on a monitor which is how I look at them most of the time, quality is just plain lousy.  Halfway thru vacation I noticed how poorly they were coming out and went back to the 2005 vintage camera, which takes much better pictures.The camera continues to work and take pictures, so I gave it 2 stars, but they just aren't good pictures.

Reviews.Title: great.....
Reviews.Author: postal soup
Reviews.Content: this has to be the best camera that i have ever owned. for the price you cant beat it. i bought mine used and it looks new.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix S1500
Reviews.Author: D. Updike "Dutchman"
Reviews.Content: Good little camera! Great photos!  The camera resolution is a bit high which allows it to take great photos.  The only drawback is that with such a large format they take a while to download to an email.

Reviews.Title: Great camera so far, Great price
Reviews.Author: Serena
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a week and a half now.. It was a little confusing at first.. I am not an experienced camera person.. I bought this camera for the continuous shot feature.. My daughter plays soccer and I am hoping this will take better pictures than the previous cheap digital cameras I have had..So far so good!! I did read all the instructions before using which is a really good idea, because this camera does do alot..I have taken some really great in motion pics with this camera and even used the video recorder during the Fourth of July weekend with no problems whatsoever.. The real test will be when soccer season starts, but for this price ($199.00), how can you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: Fujiflm S1500
Reviews.Author: R. Roth "guvno"
Reviews.Content: This was a superb camera.  I say "was" because the camera is discontinued.  If you're looking for a similar Fujifilm camera, look at the S3300.  On a good sale, it can be had for a similar price.  The #1 asset of Fujifilm still cameras is that they have both an LCD screen and an electronic viewfinder.  LCDs are useless in the sun.  You can easily toggle back and forth between the LCD and EVF.  It is not an optical viewfinder, but the next best thing.  Certanly better than nothing.  We own several still cameras, but the Fujifilm is my wife's favorite.  She is not very camera savvy, but this camera, she can easily handle.  Other than the EVF, she thinks the camera's low light capability is it's best asset.  In this capability, she feels that this camera is better than her expensive DSLR.  Lens is not removable and it can't accept filters, but tis camera can run circles around similarly priced, and even more expensive, digital range finder cameras.

Reviews.Title: It's slow camera.
Reviews.Author: An elephant
Reviews.Content: I bought it about 12 months ago and it still works fine for me. But this camera is good for static scenes. It's hard to catch a moment using it, especially inside house where light is not perfect.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Mike Ericksen
Reviews.Content: This camera is a has a great freature for the price. Though it's not a portable camera and really requires a case, and learning to use some of the feature can be hard. OVerall it a wonderful camera.

Reviews.Title: worth to buy, however I dont like the quality during night time
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: Great functions and performance, user friendly.The photo quality need to improve during night time without flashlight.

Reviews.Title: Fast shipping,perfect condition!
Reviews.Author: dess21
Reviews.Content: I received my fujifilm camera just 2days after ordering it.:)Perfect condition and came with everything as expected!Thanks Kandy:)

Reviews.Title: durability
Reviews.Author: hermantowndeb
Reviews.Content: This is my second Fuji camera.  I had a very inexpensive Fuji that I purchased with my computer in 2002.  It was one of the best cameras I ever had.  I even won a photo contest with it.  When I decided to upgrade I did a lot of research and decided on the 1500.  It worked like a charm until my recent vacation.  I had the camera for less than 2 years and the LCD screen died.  I can still take pictures, but cannot sight them or review them on the LCD. When I checked on how much it was to repair, I was told it was better just to buy a new camera.  I am not in the position to spend that kind of money every few years. So I am disappointed with the product.

Reviews.Title: Be sure your monitor is high resolution
Reviews.Author: E. Plaga
Reviews.Content: I have been concerned about photos being out of focus. Or just not sharp. I blamed it on the camera, but wasn't positive since they looked sharp on the TV and on the camera LCD. I had a friend with a new LCD monitor view them and he told me they were all very sharp and even his wife commented on that without prompting.So if you have out of focus pics, be sure you rule out the fact that an older CRT low resolution monitor could be the real cause. Not the camera. Hook it to the TV, have a few printed or have someone with a recent LCD monitor try them out before concluding anything.

Reviews.Title: Finepix S1500 - good value
Reviews.Author: John W. Tilford
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  Replaced 2005 Canon Powershot S2 IS with no drop off in quality, and much cheaper [relative to current competition, then and now].

Reviews.Title: Battery Life Not Acceptable, Macro Auto-Focus Fails
Reviews.Author: here.it.comes.again
Reviews.Content: While the image quality is not bad for the price, the battery life on this camera is a deal braker for me. I would not recommend this camera and would definitely not buy again. On a freshly charged set of four AA high-rating lithium rechargeables, I have not gotten more than 50 shots. There is a menu setting for type of battery, but getting this right doesn't help.Another deal-braker for me is the poor auto-focus performance in macro mode. I was never able to get a decent auto-focus in macro mode.Also found that the little IR gizmo that assists focus is located where your fingers are sure to block it if you use the grip the way it is designed to be used.I loved Fuji film, and I have had three Fuji digitals, but I think this was the last. All have had problems.

Reviews.Title: Daddy's camera
Reviews.Author: Denise Roberts
Reviews.Content: My father loves this camera. The setting are very user friendly. He said it was the best Father's Day gift ever.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Discover "Jim Harness"
Reviews.Content: This camera I am very pleased with it, takes vary good VIDEO AND STILL PICTURES.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Tamara Ma Mercado
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my euro trip and I can't complain about this camera, I took a lot of pictures, I bought duracell rechargeable batteries and the battery life was really long. Great camera!!!

Reviews.Title: nice camera but no bargain
Reviews.Author: Dennis I. Lauber
Reviews.Content: the camera itself works very well and takes great pictures.  this is the third fuji for me.  buying refurbished is not such a bargain,  it came without a lens cover or strap.  the cost of a new cover and strap are steep so if you buy them it brings cost of camera very near to new.  will not buy refurbished again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: RON CLARKIN
Reviews.Content: This camera was all that I expected.  My son has one and loves it also.  Love the features and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Better size - but a little more complicated
Reviews.Author: Curl Girl - "C"
Reviews.Content: I recently had my old Fujifilm finepix break after many years of continuous use.  I loved that camera and went in search of the same model/type.  Obviously, the camera type has been updated since the oriignal and I ordered the S1500.  I do really like this camera, the images are good, the size is actually smaller than my old camera which is really nice, but the options for taking pictures are a bit more cumbersome than the old camera.  Sometimes, simpler is better.  The functions are basically the same as the old version - with maybe a little upgrade - but not really on things I personally needed.  However, the way you get the options is not (I don't feel) as intuitive as the old version.I am sure I will get used to the extra little steps needed to get the same results as I take more photos.  Overall - I was REALLY happy with the service received on the order - excellent.  I do like the camera, just liked my old one a little bit better.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix 51500 camera  review
Reviews.Author: Susan S "rhaetian"
Reviews.Content: I have not had a great deal of time to study the manual, but the pictures I have taken have been excellent.  I love the panoramic feature, although it will take a bit of practice to master.  One of the main features I enjoy on this camera is the small viewfinder which is not a feature all digital cameras in the pricerange have. This is the one feature, as well as the 12x zoom and the price that sold me on this product.It is an excellent value and downloads immediately to iphoto on my Mac.  No problems there so consequently, i have not used the Finepix software at all.I am sure that once I have mastered all of the features of this camera that I will never want to use another.

Reviews.Title: Tiny dynamo !
Reviews.Author: GrammaNature "Alone in the Wilds"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a replacement for my beloved S7000, and stumbled upon this.  It is MUCH smaller than the S7000, but has twice the Mpixels & twice the optical zoom !  It took me a while to adjust to its size & slightly different arrangement or buttons, but I'm thrilled.  The only things I miss from the S7000 are the adjustable viewfinder with cushioned hood (yes, I use a viewfinder, it is VERY bright here making view screens difficult to use well), and the AE-L (auto-exposure lock) button which I used a LOT.  I'm still waiting for a true replacement for my S7000, but for the price this baby can't be beat !!

Reviews.Title: Zoom not as Powerful
Reviews.Author: Wild 4 u
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace a Fujifilm S5100 4 Mega pixel 10x zoom I fried by inserting the wrong dc adapter plug. The 12x Zoom starts from wide angle view so you are not much nearer to the object as you would expect to see. When you watch the normal view with your eyes as compared to the maximum zoom, its not much different. The zoom in my old 10x Fuji is better. The 10 mega pixel resolution is not 2.5 times better than the 4 mega pixel I had previously. Had a lot of trouble with an 8 Gb memory card with read/write errors and had to replace it with a 4 GB card, (Sandisk). Losing lost pictures in the process. The video is good however, and the manual settings allowed me to take some awesome pictures with my telescope, of the moon etc. The Macro is excellent also. Overall, 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Coleman H. Waite "Cole"
Reviews.Content: Good value and suits my purposes. Does not have a cable release. It takes one second delay to turn on and this is not reliable at times as it takes repeated activation before turning on. Taking a quick shot is problematic.It has many more features than I have use for but it has the ones that I need and does that very well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Brenda L. Osborne "wbwbrenda"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I had a used Fuji Finepix S5200 that I wore out, but I loved it so much that I bought another Fuji.  This does everything it did and more ... more zoom, more storage, and better pictures, plus a super macro in addition to the regular macro.  The only things don't like is that the LCD screen is recessed slightly instead of flush, and I get my nose a little rubbed when I take a lot of pictures.  Also, my other camera had pics for the settings - nighttime, portrait, etc. This ones doesn't, so you do have to have a little more know how.  However, this one has a panoramic view setting that is awesome!  For the price, you just can't beat it, especially if you are like me and are just learning.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: cecelia duncan
Reviews.Content: This camera is all that I expected it to be and more. I have owned a Fuji camera before and had it for several years. I was pleased with the old one and even more pleased with the new one. The auto scene recognition feature is a plus for me .I am not that familiar with different scene settings ,so having the camera adjust itself is a good feature for an amatuer.

Reviews.Title: fine pix s 1500
Reviews.Author: John C. Glover "COUGAR LOVER"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for christmas for my self and it is loaded with features , far more than i will ever use..I love the rapid picture taking .  video and audio is awsom.....  SUPER VALUE FOR THE MONEY  JOHN

Reviews.Title: Disappointed at first but it grew on me
Reviews.Author: H. Wong
Reviews.Content: I'm by no means any expert on cameras so I did a lot of research trying to balance price and quality before making my purchase. In the end I choose the Fujifilm for the manual features because I wanted to learn how to use them. My other choice (Panasonic Lumix) had, in my opinion, better reviews but didn't look like it provided much manual controls and cost maybe 40 bucks more.At first I was a little disappointed by the image quality of the Fujifilm as it seemed no better than my 4 year old 3.2MP Canon. Eventually it grew on me as I used the manual mode and more. The zoom is very nice and I love the macro and super macro mode. I don't do nearly as much editing on Photoshop after uploading anymore. I will admit that the images aren't quite as sharp as I'd like them to be but most of the time they are sharp enough and catches small details very well. Most of my images came out much better once I stopped using the automatic mode.I have not used the software that came with it. I was able to just plug it in and drag and drop the images which is very nice because I HATE having to use any kind of software to get stuff from any device that connects through USB. It's also nice because this means I don't have to take out the SD card to use on a card reader either.The only thing that bothers me about this camera now is that I haven't been able to find a nice form fitting case for it.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix S1500
Reviews.Author: Kent
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the performance of the Finepix S1500. It meeets my expectations.

Reviews.Title: I like Fujifilm FinePix
Reviews.Author: Steve "fat Steve"
Reviews.Content: As a low cost digital camera, the Fuji FinePix camera is an excellent value.  It takes a little experience to navigate all the features, and once in a while it is necessary to consult the owner's manual.Overall this is an excellent value, and since it uses four AA batteries, new batteries are no further away than the nearest convenience store.  This is a very strong advantage over cameras which used their own special batteries.After using this camera for several weeks, the only negative is that to remove the SD card, it is necessary to open the compartment where the batteries are located.  I've dumped the batteries on the floor a couple of times, a separate access for the SD card would be nice.  For this reason alone I would give it slightly less than a full five stars.Once you master the many functions available, the Fuji FinePix camera is a joy to use, it is inexpensive enough there is no worry about carrying it in challenging situations yet it produces excellent images for its price range.Since I purchased the Fuji FinePix at Amazon.com it is my camera of choice over the three other digitals available to me.  I recommend it highly, but take time to study the manual and practice with the camera to get full utility.

Reviews.Title: great camera love it!
Reviews.Author: S. Knaebel "horselady"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera that is easy to use, easy to operate, and a very good value. My first digital camera. I thought it would be hard to use, but it is very simple to shoot all type of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Finepix S1500
Reviews.Author: Bailey
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera as an affordable alternative to most of the high priced digital SLR's.  This thing is great and takes super crisp pictures.  I have had a bit of camera experience and this thing has all the bells and whistles needed without having to give up your retirement fund to pay for it.  I love the Fujifilm film selection and the quick adjustment of shutter speed, iso, etc.  The only two things that bug me are the lack of threads on the lens, and the sound of the zoom in movies. Reviews.Title: The perfect camera for beginers photographer
Reviews.Author: Alan E. Correa Salazar

I'm starting to understand the art of the photography so I need a camera with more features than a point and shoot model.This camera is perfect for beginers photographers. Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: A. Irvine
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to learn and use.  I find the zoom all I would ever need;reminds me of the day I had a SLR with separate wide and tele lenes.  And 10 megapixels for that price!  Could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Floyd J. Zwer
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent camera to use with very good results.I would say that if you are in the need to purchase a goodcamera, this is it.

Reviews.Title: In this range of cameras (consumer mid-range) this is the best value!
Reviews.Author: Omar "I tought what happened in Vegas, stayed...
Reviews.Content: In this range of consumer cameras, the mid-range between the cheap digital cameras and just before the high-end DSLR/etc (what I call the "mid-range consumer cameras") this is possibly the best value-per-dollar camera based on my research. I own it and it's awesome... Other than the bundled software, but I get around that because all but one of my computers are Macs.

Reviews.Title: Fuji digital
Reviews.Author: Addie K. Pressgrove "Addie"
Reviews.Content: Overall this camera is OK.  Don't like the fact that the flash does not pop up automatically.  Also, in auto, can't set to top color.  The picture quality is good.  It is not as fast as I had hoped when taking action pictures, but can live with that since I have a DSLR this is great for action shots.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S1500 and Deluxe Accessory Kit
Reviews.Author: Bagpipes48
Reviews.Content: I received my above mentioned merchandise on Monday, 26 Jan 10. It came in a well padded and secure box. My new digital camera is a departure into a new venue for me as I have a 35mm SLR that is as old as dirt (and love). I will have to take time to get use to all the new buttons, settings and workings. As shaky as I am becoming as I age, I think I will love the focus lock, face detection and red-eye removal features.After I have used to it for a while, I will return and leave my opinion of its usability, ease of use, ability and quality of downloaded photos and other things I find would be useful here. So far I am very pleased with it and would recommend Ace Digital Photo to anyone considering photography parts, accessories or cameras. Good job folks. Hooah.

Reviews.Title: good camera for good price
Reviews.Author: S. Nadkar
Reviews.Content: Camera takes nice pictures. Great camera. Fujifilm FinePix S1500 10MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Dual Image Stabilized Optical Zoom

Reviews.Title: FujiFilmFinePixS1500
Reviews.Author: M. Maute
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a Christmas gift for my husband - he LOVES it! And in this economy, the price was perfect compared to similar cameras for hundreds more. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Marshall
Reviews.Content: I'd been using a point and shoot Nikon CoolPix for years and was never really happy with the camera. I was looking for an upgrade, and this FujiFilm FinePix S1500 camera was on sale for a great price. I use a camera often in my work -- photographing bands and street fashion -- but I am not a professional photographer so I was not ready for a digital SLR. It's also important to me to have a camera I can easily carry in my purse, and I don't want to deal with switching lenses.What I was looking for was:* improved picture quality from the CoolPix* flash for night/low light shots* portability* ease of useI am completely satisfied with all these aspects in regard to the Fuji FinePix. It's a larger camera body than I had before, but it's still portable. It's large enough to have a more professional look and actually mimics a digital SLR in body type. The camera has decent zoom and an optional flash. It can also take video, though I've not yet tried that feature. It requires 4 batteries, but they seem to last forever. I've taken a couple hundred pictures on one set of batteries so far. The flash works well in low light, though for photographing bands I kind of like the color-rich but slightly blurred effect of going without flash. Other photographers might not agree. At times, daylight pics seem a little washed out (a problem I've noticed in other cameras such digital has gone to more than 5 MP) but this can be edited a bit and probably changing the setting would help, too. As far as the ease of use, I was able to load the batteries, turn the camera on and start using it right away with no problems. It's very user friendly.While this camera probably wouldn't do for a professional photographer, it's great for an amateur and really you can't beat this bargain.

Reviews.Title: Compact and versatile
Reviews.Author: J. Larson
Reviews.Content: This camera fits well in your hand, is loaded with many features and has a great zoom.I bought it for my daughter and son in law for Christmas and they are more than happy with it.You can't go wrong for the price.Unfortunately, unless you get a digital SLR there is that annoying camera lag when you take a picture. For those used to that this will not present a problem.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money!
Reviews.Author: Rolando Vargas
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a little over a week. But I've already taken it to Vegas (where I took easily over 400 pictures) and then to a mountain. I've replaced the original set of batteries around 300 pictures (the second set is still there and going strong).I have to say I'm an amateur photographer with a desire to learn more about photography, so I got this instead of an DSLR mainly for the price tag and the features this camera has. There are other cameras out there with the same features of this one that cost around twice of this one.So far, I'm very satisfied/impressed with some of the results I've got from this camera! Actually I'm loving it! I've read all the reviews out there before buying this camera, so I knew what I was buying... and I still feel I'm impressed with the quality of this camera.The Panorama feature has been blowing everyone away. I have a friend with a DSLR who got a little jealous of the results I was getting with this camera (because some of these was better than hers). She actually challenged me to take a panorama picture of the mountain where we were staying to blow it up and put it in a wall at her place. I have to say she was very satisfied with what I showed her.I like that it has an Aperture priority mode and a Shutter speed mode. It lets you come up with pretty nice results. The Auto mode is very good. Most of the pictures I've taken have been using Auto mode and they have come out great.You do need to keep in mind that this camera is a little on the big side (most definitively not a pocketable camera, so don't think of bringing to a club or something like that).The SD slot is in the same place where you place your batteries. I would like a lid of its own. You just have to be a little careful of not dropping the batteries.Bottom line... I absolutely recommend this camera to anyone! I'm absolutely in love with this camera and everyone is very impressed by it when I show it around too!

Reviews.Title: Great Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: R.C. Black "Mad Photog"
Reviews.Content: I began my travel photography in the 50's and have used many cameras, rangefinders, slr, p&s;, and this one is one of the easiest to carry around and use. I am pleased with the output and the video option is quite nice. Recorded my grandsons' wrestling tournament and had quite acceptable video images. My single issue with this is the lack of ease with which to alter the output from the flash. I'm looking into a deflector or diffuser to soften the flash. It has plenty of output for most rooms. Overall, I am quite please and look forward to a long relationship with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Cathy D. Terry
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas gift for my daughter in law and she absolutely loved it! The picture quality is very sharp and bright!

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck camera
Reviews.Author: Smabbles
Reviews.Content: This is a major upgrade from your point and shoot cameras, but is just as simple to use. Its compact size makes it easy to tote around. It also has alot of features that are fun to mess with. I would suggest this camera to anyone who wants to upgrade their camera and is on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: William E. Frey "Wilhelm F"
Reviews.Content: My first FUJI S1500 purchased through Amazon.com had issues with focus.  Occasionally I would get a picture that was in crisp focus but the majority varied from fuzzy to way out of focus.  Also, the camera would very occasionally power-up with a "Lens Position Error" that required a power off/on cycle to clear.  I contcted FUJI through their on-line customer service and never got a reply.  I contacted Amazon and they replaced the camera immediately.The new replacement is just great in comparison.  The camera is loaded with features you won't find on many others especially for the price.  I love especially its small size, large 12x zoom, the viewfinder for sunny days when you can't see the display on the back and the 'P' program mode.  The picture quality is not crisp down to the pixel but for $160, what do you want?  It is a great camera and I will try to review it again as I use it more.I just wish the manufacturers (or aftermarket suppliers) would make tight fitting cases for just the camera like used to be with the old 35mm SLRs and point and shoot.  It is not good to haul any camera around on a strap without protection and the cases (I should say boxes) that are sold are so cumbersome and in the way when you take the camera out to use it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: silverwillow "nicole"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  I have read all the reviews on amazon before I bought it and there were not very many bad ones and alot of good ones.  I have not had any of the problems the other people have had like focus or read errors.  Not sure what they were doing to the camera but never happened to me. The only thing is I still haven't learned everything this thing can do.  It has sooo many features! You do have to press a button to put the flash on but I rarely need the flash, it auto adjusts the light somehow.  I have had a Kodak for many years and wanted to get a better camera with more mps and a larger zoom and slr's are too pricey and I'm not sure if I would know how to use one so I bought this camera and I am very pleased. For the price I think this was a steal!

Reviews.Title: Best Bargain
Reviews.Author: J. Burchett
Reviews.Content: this is the best bargain on a digital camera that I have seen in a long time. I purchased it right before Christmas, Didn't really have a lot of time to play around with it before the big day. But took some great pictures anyway. It does take a little bit to get used to the different settings but that is with any new camera you purchase.  I love this camera and I am very happy that I decided to purchase it, I would defiantly recommend this camera to anyone that is wanting a camera that is above the normal point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA FOR A BEGINNER LIKE ME
Reviews.Author: Donnie Jackson "Be Good"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for xmas and so far, for a beginner like me, it is great.  The controls are very easy to use, it feels like a lightweight SLR (since that is the direction I'm headed with my next purchase), nice grip.  I was impressed with the panoramic 2 or 3 shot capture, it leave a partial of the last picture so lining up each shot is a breeze.  I don't know if that is old news or not but I loved that feature.  I haven't printed up any pictures yet so I can't comment on the quality of printed images but the images on my computer are nice and sharp, very clear. Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix focus f...err, problems
Reviews.Author: Calikat "kattykat"
Reviews.Content: Visiting California on vacation, I found myself with a defective camera.  I purchased the Fuji FinePix S1500 through Amazon and got all of an hours use out of it.  While zooming in for a close-up of a cactus flower, the lens jammed and the display read "Focus Error."  No amount of resetting, changeing batteries or swapped out memory cards cleared the error.  Before giving into my baser instincts and flinging the thing against a rock, I decided to return it and give up on Fuji cameras completely.  I say completely because the camera that died on me in the first place was a Fuji FinePix S1000, bought new less than two months ago.  That one worked fine before it locked up with a "Focus Error" as well.  The most unfortunate part about this, other than having to hunt down yet a third camera (no Fuji this time,) is the fact that both of them did take beautiful pictures before expiring.  I don't know if this is a design flaw or just incredibly bad luck, but I couldn't advise anyone to purchase either camera.

Reviews.Title: Had high hopes but it didn't cut it in the end
Reviews.Author: Leslie Greer
Reviews.Content: After researching cameras for quite awhile and reading lots of reviews, I decided on the Fujifilm Finepix S1500. It had all of the features I was looking for at a great price and good reviews to boot. The following is my observations and experience with this camera.I should state that while I intended to buy this camera from Amazon, I ended up spending a few extra bucks and buying it at my local Target so that I could have it immediately.First thing I noticed was the camera was a lot smaller than I expected. It wasn't all that much bigger than my 5 year old Sony Cybershot 5.1 mp that I was replacing. Not a bad thing, just different than I expected and someone might find useful. It fit really well in my hand and was very comfortable to hold. I could hang it around my neck and walk around comfortably without any feeling of pressure on my neck. All of the buttons worked well and the camera body seemed to be well made.After my initial observations, I briefly read through the manual that came in the box. I am not new to digital cameras so I was able to figure things out very quickly. The menus were easy to navigate and understand. I fired it up and began to test it out. I was extremely excited about the Super Macro mode so I tried that first. Everything was great and it was so easy! I was so excited. It took pictures of my fingerprints on my laptop buttons with perfect clarity and extreme detail! I was amazed! However, that amazement quickly took a nosedive.I started taking pictures of things around the house and my son using different basic automatic settings, flash on/off, etc. The scenes would switch fine in automatic mode and I had no problems with any of the settings. The pictures all seemed to turn out ok judging from the view in the LCD but I decided to wait until I uploaded them to my computer and really checked them out to make a true judgment.The night sky was beautiful and clear so I decided to test it outside with some pictures of the moon and other random things. As soon as I lifted the camera up and tilted it towards the moon, thin, horizontal purple lines appeared across the LCD. I snapped a few pictures and the same lines were in all of the pictures and they all turned out terribly. I was very careful with the camera and it was not jarred, dropped or anything that would suddenly cause the lines. I thought it was just a weird thing and went back inside to play around some more. The lines steadily got even worse. Now they were not only purple but white as well and they were in all of the pictures! If I tilted the camera up to take a picture of the ceiling fan, they were definitely worse. It happened in all the settings, with or without the flash, and wouldn't stop no matter what.I decided to put the camera up for the night and uploaded all of the pictures I had taken to my computer. I did not use the provided software so I cannot review that part. I just took out the memory card and popped it into my computer's card reader. Had no issues whatsoever with that aspect. As I looked over all of the pictures I had taken, I was extremely disappointed. The ONLY ones that came out even remotely good were the ones I took in Super Macro mode. They were actually very impressive (fingerprint photos I previously mentioned).  The pictures where I had used the zoom looked terrible and blurry.  All of the others were either just OK or terrible.  Overall, I was not impressed with the picture quality at all. They were very "grainy" and to be honest I think my cell phone takes better quality pictures. My old digital camera definitely took much better pictures and it was 5 years old and had a fraction of the megapixels, zoom and other settings.The next day, I tried out the camera again. Same weird, horizontal lines and crappy pictures no matter the setting, location, or light source. I boxed it up and off to Target I went. I returned the camera, opting for a refund instead of a replacement, because the picture quality was absolutely not up to the standard that it should be in my opinion. I'm not sure if I just got a lemon or what but I did not feel like going through the hassle again hoping I get a good one. The whole purpose of getting a new camera was for it to take better pictures than the one I was replacing and it certainly failed to do that even before the weird lines started, so I am moving on. I had very high hopes for this camera but unfortunately it did not live up to my expectations.

Reviews.Author: Jobrazen
Reviews.Content: 2011-My girlfriend and I have had this camera for a couple years now. Honestly, it takes really good pictures. Reviews.Title: Stay away! Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Joanne Bouthillier "Joanne B"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera back in December of 2009 from a local camera store, after a couple of months of using it I have three words... PIECE-OF-CRAP!!! Honestly I don't really know where to begin...Picture Quality (or lack a there of)For a 10 Megapixel camera, I found the picture quality to be pretty lousy. My 5 Megapixel Kodak point-and-shoot which I purchased a few years ago takes way sharper images. Overall I found a lot of the pictures that I took with this camera to be lackluster (dull, grainy) You would think that for a 10 Megapixel camera with 12 times optical zoom, the pictures should be unbelievably crisp and clear. Clearly not the case with this camera.Battery Life (again, or a lack there of)This thing goes thought batteries like mad, when using this camera it is a good idea to invest in some rechargeable batteries. The camera is also very picky about the batteries that you put in, if even one battery you put in becomes slightly weak, it will have a problem. There is no battery level indicator anywhere on this camera, the only thing that even comes close it a big red flashing battery icon in the middle of the screen, right before your camera stops working.Video Quality (once again, or a lack there of)The video on this camera is absolutely terrible, even in supposed "High Res" mode, it still looks pretty grainy. My 10 year old VHS video camera has better video quality. The audio is pretty bad as well; basically all you can hear is the sound of the lens loudly grinding in and out of focus, because for some reason the engineers at Fuji thought it would be cute for the video to have an "Auto-focus". For a 10 Megapixel camera, one would expect much better video quality.Bells and WhistlesDon't be fooled by all the bells and whistles that the seller mentions in the description of this product, let's face it, honestly only a couple you are really going to ever use.The manual that came with the camera was pretty lousy, all it said basically was how to hold the camera and where the button was to take a picture, and that's about it! Your are pretty much left to figure out everything on your own, and basically for the first couple of weeks all you pictures will be nothing but trial and error.Another thing that really bugs me about this camera is that even when the camera is in "Manual", I found that many times that camera will actually "fight" with you when you are trying to set a certain shutter speed and aperture setting. For example you change the shutter speed, and for some reason the camera (even thought it is in "Manual"), will change the aperture on you, messing up the built in light meter. Which can be really frustrating, especially when you need a specific shutter speed or aperture setting.The "Auto-Focus" on this thing is really, really, really annoying, sometimes you will be taking a picture of something, and have the camera all set up and in focus, then right when you take a picture, for some reason that's when the "Auto-Focus" kicks in and brings everything out of focus.The "Auto mode" is pretty ridiculous, I found the especially near sun-rise or sun-set the pictures for some reason come out over-exposed.ConclusionMy only advice is "DONT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!", you are much, much, much better off spending $100 or $200 more on something that you can actually take half decent pictures with. Personally I think Fuji should actually think for once what I photographer would want in a camera, instead of just what some group of engineers want in a camera. In short, I would not recommend this camera to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: BEWARE, DON'T BUY
Reviews.Author: Kelly A. Drover
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera two weeks before I went on vacation to the Oregon Coast.  I read all the reviews and did all my research.  I saw that it did have some bad reviews but I thought the good reviews outweighed the bad ones.  When I received the camera, my husband and I loved it.  It worked wonderfully.  We left for vacation on a Thursday nite, and by Monday morning the camera was dead.  We were at the Aquarium in Newport, Oregon.  I couldn't wait to take pictures.  I went to turn the camera on, nothing.  We switched batteries in it, went and bought new batteries at the gift shop and still nothing.  My daughter had her little polaroid camera and we tested the batteries in hers to make sure the batteries were ok and they were.  We tried throughout our vacation to get the camera to work, but it never would turn back on.  I was so upset.  Stood at the Aquarium and cried because it was our vacation and would never get these moments back.  Good thing for my daughter's polaroid.  So please buyers beware.  Listen to the bad reviews and don't buy this camera.  Don't let it ruin a vacation or other precious moments!!  I do have to say that Amazon was great about taking the camera back and refunding my money in a timely manner.  Thank you Amazon!

The following statement is not my opinion but what I experienced with the Fuji digital camera S1500.The photographs have an over exposed washed out appearance. Reviews.Title: Too many features. All my pictures are blurry
Reviews.Author: jvjgmom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a month ago. It's a well made camera, and it had alot of good reviews. It has too many features for me. It's too complicated. I did like the panoramic feature and that was fairly easy to use. For some reason, all my pictures are turning out blurry since I have gotten the camera. I don't have the patience for it and neither do my kids. I took 50 or more pictures today of my children to try and get a nice picture for Christmas cards. I thought I had figured it out and would get a nice clear picture, but low and behold; Awesome pose of my kids, blurry picture again. I'm frustrated and disappointed. I finally have given up and I am buying a new camera and going to try and return this, but I just missed my cutoff date for returns so will probably have to accept a % of a refund. I hate this camera. If you can understand the features and have the time and patience to figure out how to just take a nice clear picture with it, then it's the camera for you. I would not recommend it though.

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased this camera for me as a birthday gift.  When I got the camera I inserted the batteries and memory card and turned it on.  When the settings came up it was a little blurry but I thought it was just because of the light I was under; WRONG.  When I got to a picture mode the whole screen had a horrible purplish color to everything. the image was so out of focus I couldn't tell if I was looking at my husband or my cat. I tried to look through the EVF to see if it made a difference and it was the same story.  After several shots were taken, which all came up purple with huge black lines through it, I tried different settings.  I tried everything, even took it outside to see a different lighting.  Nothing changed.  I called Fujifilm and the tech support told me it was a bad sensor and to send it back.I tried to be hopeful that the good reviews would outweigh the bad reviews and the problems other people found were just one in a million.  I was wrong.  Camera is on it's way back to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Inadequate for digitizing microfilm, Distortion with extreme close-up.
Reviews.Author: B. Long
Reviews.Content: I know very little about cameras, so I readily concede that all of my complaints may be due to my own ignorance.I wanted this camera for a very specific purpose.  I have a lot of microfilm and microfiche, which I am hoping to be able to selectively digitize (without paying for an expensive microfilm-to-digital machine).  I had read on the web that cameras with Super Macro Mode could be used for this purpose.  I have an old Olympus camera from 5 years ago which has Super Macro Mode, but it does not get closer than 3.5 inches.  This is satisfactory for some microfilm images (such as front pages of magazines) but the magnification is not strong enough to read text in newspaper microfilm, or microfiche.  The Fujifilm FinePix S1500 specs stated that its Super Macro Mode can be as close as .8in (that's over four times closer than my old camera, plus it has over twice the resolution).  So I hoped that the Fujifilm camera would greatly enable my ability to digitize my microfilm, perhaps by a factor of 9.  But unfortunately, those hopes have been dashed.To my major disappointment, images from this Fujifilm camera at the closest distance of .8in are not as close-up as my old camera at 3.5in.  (Obviously the Fujifilm camera uses a much wider angle.)  To make matters worse, the Fujifilm camera at closest Super Macro Mode has bad bulging away from the image's center, causing distortion in any photographic images from the microfilm I am trying to digitize.  I have uploaded a photo graph showing the extent of that bulging, which was totally absent in my old camera's Super Macro Mode.  The images taken with the Fujifilm camera do have sharper resolution, so by zooming into the saved image I can read microfilmed text a little clearer.  But it's not that much clearer, and nowhere nearly enough for my needs.  Small print on microfilm is still unreadable.So I'm rating the camera a 3, because I was so disappointed with it.  I assume it is still a good, solid general use camera, and if you don't want it for the special purpose of digitizing microfilm, you might be very satisfied with Fujifilm FinePix S1500.

Reviews.Title: Camera software is brain dead and not Linux compatible
Reviews.Author: kevin okane
Reviews.Content: Camera seems nice but cannot be used without Fuji's software which is mainly designed to get you to order prints from Fuji. The Fuji software is only compatible with Windows and Mac OS - it is not Linux compatible. You cannot access the camera from Linux. The camera does not present itself as a directory structure USB device. You can only access it with the Fuji crapware. If you are a Linux user, do not buy this camera. Fuji's main aim is to get you to buy prints so, even if you are a Windows or Mac user, consider if adware is really how you want to access your purchase.

Reviews.Content: Ordered the camera on 7/4 and it was supposed to arrive by 7/17.  It didn't arrive and the tracking info provided indicated that it had not been picked up from shipper (amazon.com).  I sent an email to find out where my order was and the response said to wait until 7/28.  I waited and the camera never arrived.  I sent another email and was told that the camera was now temporarily out of stock.  I cancelled the order, got a refund, and ordered from another dealer through amazon.com.  The camera arrived in less than a week.
